metadata.title: CVE-2019-11725 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When a user navigates to site marked as unsafe by the Safebrowsing API,warning messages are displayed and navigation is interrupted but resourcesfrom the same site loaded through websockets are not blocked, leading tothe loading of unsafe resources and bypassing safebrowsing protections.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11725` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
